laboratory_examinations.findings: EEG showed abrupt onset of sharply contoured 9 Hz waves increasing slightly in voltage and evolving into medium voltage 5 â€“ 6 Hz theta activity, without focal onset or discrete spikes. Paucity of slow wave and REM sleep noted. The awake background was normal.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Increased seizure frequency was noted between ages 16 and 27 years, characterized by multiple clinical and electrical seizures arising out of stage 2 sleep every 10-30 minutes, lasting 30-60 seconds each.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Absence of slow-wave sleep and reduced amounts of REM sleep, without evidence of central or obstructive apnea.
DNA sequencing showed the presence of serine 284 to leucine mutation in the CHRNa4 gene, reported as a disease-associated mutation in individuals with ADNFLE.
EEG showed multiple events occurring during stage 2 sleep averaging every 60 seconds, lasting on average 6-8 seconds. Some seizures lasting up to 60 seconds were noted.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: On the second day of admission, following application of a 7-mg nicotine patch, there was almost complete resolution of clinical and electrical events, increased duration of slow-wave sleep, and REM sleep was recorded.
